ygData.subject: thoughts about the deduplicator
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, We are currently deploying the Portuguese web archive and the next step is to start using the deduplicator. I read the paper Managing duplicates across

Subject: thoughts about the deduplicator
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=332932000

Hi,

We are currently deploying the Portuguese web archive and the next step 
is to start using the deduplicator.

I read the paper "Managing duplicates across sequential crawls" and I 
would like to share some thoughts specially about section 4.3 Filtering 
after download � DeDuplicator:

"Matching by URL requires a search in the index for the current URL. If 
no hit is
found the index can be optionally searched again, but this time for an 
equivalent URL
using the normalized URL field. If no match is found there either then 
the URL is
considered to be new. If a hit is found the content digests are 
compared. If identical,
further processing of the URL is skipped.
...
Matching by content digest works in a similar fashion. If there is no 
match then the
document is new. If there is a match then the URLs are compared and then the
normalized URLs. If a match is found then further processing may be 
skipped."

The results I obtained from previous experiments (Fig. 15 and 16 of 
http://xldb.fc.ul.pt/daniel/docs/papers/gomes06urlPersistence.pdf) 
suggest that using "content digest match" is more efficient, because the 
probability of having an URL match after having a content digest match 
is higher than the opposite (~90% against ~50% for less than 100 days 
between sequential crawls). I think this might an useful information for 
tunning the deduplicator and Heritrix.

"It is however interesting to note that any match by content digest 
means that the
document has been stored before. While we, currently, insist on an URL 
match as
well, that is simply because the ARC files do not offer the ability to 
write a
�reference� link stating that a document identical to this other 
document at a different
URL was found when this URL was visited. This facility is planned in the 
revised
ARC format WARC."

 From this text I concluded that the deduplicator cannot eliminate 
duplicates served by different URLs. For instance, it does not eliminate 
duplicates in mirror sites.

It looks that this behavior is due to the limitations of the ARC format.

However, if we are using the wARC format would there be any problem in 
not performing the URL match after the content digest match? Can we 
disable this URL match in the latest version of the deduplicator?

Thank you for your attention.

Best regards,

-- 
/Daniel Gomes
